org.gridfour.compress

Class PredictorModelDifferencingWithNulls

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gridfour.compress.PredictorModelDifferencingWithNulls
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPredictorModel

    public class PredictorModelDifferencingWithNulls
extends Object
implements IPredictorModel
    Applies the differencing model to the data with special treatment for non-continuous values. The differencing model always predicts that the current value in a series will have the same value as the prior value.

      • getSeed

        public int getSeed()
        Description copied from interface: IPredictorModel

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        an arbitrary integer value

      • encode

        public int encode(int nRows,
                  int nColumns,
                  int[] values,
                  byte[] output)
        Description copied from interface: IPredictorModel
        Encodes the specified data using the predictor model to develop computed adjustments for the data grid.

        This routine returns the seed value detected in the data. This value is usually the first entry in the input value. In cases where the data contains nulls, the seed is sometimes the mean value of the non-null entries.

        The length of the encoded output will be a maximum of 5 times the total number of entries in the input (it is usually much shorter than that). The encoding array should be dimensioned large enough to accept the maximum sized output.

        Specified by:
        encode in interface IPredictorModel
        Parameters:
        nRows - the number of rows in the raster data grid
        nColumns - the number of columns in the data data grid
        values - the input values to be encoded
        output - the output encoding
        Returns:
        if successful, the number of bytes in the output encoding; otherwise, a value -1 to indicate an encoding failure.

      • decode

        public void decode(int seed,
                   int nRows,
                   int nColumns,
                   byte[] encoding,
                   int offset,
                   int length,
                   int[] output)
        Description copied from interface: IPredictorModel
        Decodes the specified data using the predictor model to compute output values from the specified input.
        Specified by:
        decode in interface IPredictorModel
        Parameters:
        seed - a seed value to provide the initial value for the encoding
        nRows - the number of rows in the raster data grid
        nColumns - the number of columns in the raster data grid
        encoding - the input values for the encoding, usually dimensions to nRows*nColumns
        offset - the starting offset in the encoding array from which data is to be taken.
        length - the length of the valid section of the encoding array from which data is to be taken.
        output - array to accept the output data values, dimensions to at least nRows*nColumns

      • isNullDataSupported

        public boolean isNullDataSupported()
        Description copied from interface: IPredictorModel
        Indicates that the predictor model is intended to handle null values. In many real-world raster data products, the transition from regions of valid data to null data is frequently discontinuous. While most predictor models can handle the transition, the results often compress poorly. This method indicates if a predictor is intended to support cells with null data.
        Specified by:
        isNullDataSupported in interface IPredictorModel
        Returns:
        true if null values are permitted; otherwise false.

      • getPredictorType

        Gets the predictor type.
        Specified by:
        getPredictorType in interface IPredictorModel
        Returns:
        a valid enumeration corresponding the the type of predictor
